change.item: Revised to update encoding and add unitid. Changed name from George Karcz to Jerzy F. Karcz.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::George Karcz Papers)//EN" "reg_324.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Jerzy F. Karcz Papers, 1917-1970
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: (40 manuscript boxes, 4 card file boxes, 1 phonotape

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, research notes, statistical surveys and reports, and miscellanea, relating to Soviet and East European agriculture and economics. Jerzy F. Karcz was also known as George Karcz.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jerzy F. Karcz Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1971.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, arranged alphabetically by last name of correspondent.
Correspondence, memoranda, reports, lists, charts, notes, printed matter, xerox copies, etc., arranged alphabetically by subject.
Handwritten and typewritten manuscripts, essays, etc., arranged alphabetically by title.
Clippings, miscellaneous, notes, charts, lists, etc.
3x5 cards containing author, title, and subject reference to materials used for research.
